TEXT: The applicant , born in DATE , presently resides in GPE , GPE . In his application form , he states that he has NORP nationality .
a.

On DATE the applicant arrived in GPE . He requested asylum DATE . He had a NORP passport but stated that he considered himself to be a citizen of GPE and not of GPE . He claimed further that he had been a soldier in the NORP army from which he had deserted .

On DATE ORG ( ORG invandrarverk ) rejected the applicant ’s request and ordered his deportation to GPE . ORG found that the applicant held both NORP and NORP citizenship . Noting that the prevailing situation in GPE rendered a deportation to that country impossible , the ORG examined the applicant ’s situation with respect to GPE . ORG found that he did not risk to be sent from GPE to GPE or to be punished for desertion in GPE .

The applicant appealed to ORG ( Utlänningsnämnden ) . On DATE ORG granted the applicant a temporary residence permit until DATE and quashed the deportation order . In so doing , the ORG referred to a Government decision of CARDINAL DATE according to which the worsened situation in GPE constituted an impediment to the deportation of asylum seekers to that country .

On DATE the applicant submitted a new application for a residence permit . He referred to his previous statements and added that he is an ethnic NORP from GPE in GPE . Further , he had been informed by his parents in GPE that he had been sentenced to CARDINAL years’ imprisonment for desertion . He was convinced that , if returned to that country , he would have to serve the sentence and also risk harassment as the majority of the population in his home district were now NORP . The applicant referred also to the time he had spent in GPE .

On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s new application and ordered his deportation to GPE . ORG had regard to a guiding decision taken by ORG on DATE . In that decision the ORG stated , inter alia , the following :
( Translation )

“ As regards the situation in GPE and the region , the ongoing peace process , based on a general agreement on peace in GPE , has lead to stabilisation . The relations between GPE and GPE have improved . GPE has been admitted into ORG . Acts of warfare have not occurred on NORP territory since DATE . The risk of further conflicts appears unlikely . The general situation in GPE has improved in such a way since the Government ’s previous assessment in DATE that nowadays NORP citizens can generally be afforded protection in GPE . ”

As in its previous decision concerning the applicant , the ORG found that he could not be sent back to GPE . ORG considered , however , that the applicant ’s submissions did not show that he was unable to go to GPE .
Following the applicant ’s appeal , ORG , on DATE , quashed ORG decision and referred the case back for re - examination . ORG found that no oral hearing had been held by ORG , as required by law .

ORG later held an oral hearing at which the applicant stated that , being a NORP , he would be persecuted by NORP in GPE . He maintained further that he had obtained his NORP passport illegally and that he could not be considered as a citizen of that country . He had no relatives or friends in GPE and could not see any reasons why GPE should admit him . Allegedly , during his stay in GPE he had adjusted to NORP society .

In a decision of DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s new application and ordered that he be deported to either GPE or GPE . ORG referred to ORG decision of CARDINAL DATE in which the following conclusions were drawn as regards the situation in GPE :
( Translation )

“ Recently , the situation in GPE has improved . After the parties signed a general agreement on peace in GPE there is an ongoing peace process in the country . It has been strengthened by the establishment of Government institutions and the general elections held in DATE . There are still actual restrictions on the movement of people within the territory of the ORG . The possibility to return to the home district without risking harassment and outrage is , in the present circumstances , dependent on the prevailing ethnic composition of the population in the district . In the ORG ’s view , it is now possible to return to the home district where one ’s own ethnic group is in the majority . This view corresponds to the position taken by the ORG in regard to the return of people to GPE . The relative stability enjoyed by “ the majority population ” in the respective regions leads to the conclusion that asylum seekers from such places in GPE can no longer be considered as generally being in need of protection . ”

ORG noted that , according to information from the ORG High Commissioner for Refugees ( ORG ) , the majority of the population in GPE were NORP . Consequently , the applicant ’s fear of persecution was considered to be exaggerated . ORG considered also that the amnesty laws enacted in GPE would be applicable to the applicant .

As regards the possible deportation of the applicant to GPE , ORG considered that the applicant ’s NORP passport was genuine and noted that the applicant had previously stated that this was the case . According to ORG , there was thus no reason to assume that GPE would not afford him protection . In this respect , the ORG again referred to information available from ORG and the ORG . This view had been confirmed also by ORG . Finally , the ORG found that there were no reasons of a humanitarian nature to grant the applicant a residence permit .
On DATE ORG upheld ORG decision .

On DATE the applicant submitted yet another application for a residence permit to ORG . He referred to his long stay in GPE and to the fact that he had already had a temporary residence permit . Furthermore , he claimed that , while serving in the NORP army , he had seen how his neighbour and a work - mate had been killed . His experiences during the war , a difficult childhood and his fears of persecution and punishment for desertion in GPE had impaired his mental health and rendered the deportation to that country impossible . He could not be deported to GPE either , as he had no connections to GPE and as the situation for NORP in GPE had worsened as of late . He invoked a medical certificate issued on DATE by chief physician E.A. and psychologist PERSON at the psychiatric clinic at the hospital in GPE , according to which the applicant suffered from insomnia , anxiety and flashbacks from the war .
By a decision of DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s latest application .

In a further medical certificate issued at the above - mentioned psychiatric clinic on DATE physician ORG stated that the applicant , as from DATE , received treatment at the clinic for a post - traumatic stress syndrome . ORG found that there was a considerable risk that the applicant would attempt to commit suicide . The applicant states that he has since left the clinic but that he continues to visit his psychiatrist on a regular basis .
Relevant domestic law

Under LAW of LAW ( Lagen om psykiatrisk tvångsvård , DATE ) , such care shall be terminated at the request of the competent police authority whenever the person placed in care is ordered to be deported . This presupposes , however , that the chief physician finds that the alien ’s condition allows that the deportation takes place . According to LAW , no appeal lies against the chief physician ’s decision .
